english: to cling; to long for; to hope for; Sichuan (abbr.)

etymology.description: Pictogram — a huge snake; however, in 邑 and 色 it represents a person kneeling.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a large snake with a curved body, giving it a simple, iconic shape. In certain composite characters like 邑 and 色, the same shape was repurposed to depict a kneeling person, showing how the graphic was reassigned contextually. The sense of clinging or yearning may echo the image of something coiling or holding on.

examples.chinese: 孩子巴着妈妈不放(孩子巴著媽媽不放)。
examples.english: The child clung to his mother and wouldn’t let go.

examples.chinese: 他巴不得马上成功(他巴不得馬上成功)。
examples.english: He is eager to succeed right away.

examples.chinese: 巴蜀地区风景秀丽(巴蜀地區風景秀麗)。
examples.english: The Ba–Shu region (Sichuan area) has beautiful scenery.
